definitions.definition: The crime of betraying one’s own country.
An act of treachery, betrayal of trust or confidence.
A tiny freshwater fish, Poecilia reticulata, popular in home aquariums, that usually has a plain body and black or dark blue tail for the females and a more colorful tail for the males.
definitions.example: Fred kept a tank of guppies by the windowsill.

definitions.definition: By extension, any tiny fish.
A tube holding paintballs before they are loaded into the gun.
definitions.example: 2001, John R. Little, Curtis Wong, Ultimate Paintball Field Guide (page 177)

definitions.definition: The ground near the edge of a lake; the land adjacent to a lake.
By the side of a lake.
A Scottish cap with a flat top and a plume but no brim; a blue bonnet.
A heavy walking shoe.
An Oxford shoe.
A figured woollen petticoat.
A tale or story that is part of the oral tradition of a people or a place.
To consume a substance as a medication without the advice of a physician, in order to treat a real or imagined condition.
To cover on the top or with a top.
definitions.example: I like my ice cream topped with chocolate sauce.

definitions.definition: To cut or remove the top (as of a tree)
definitions.example: I don't want to be bald, so just top my hair.

definitions.definition: To excel, to surpass, to beat.
definitions.example: Titanic was the most successful film ever until it was topped by another Cameron film, Avatar.

definitions.definition: To be in the lead, to be at number one position (of).
definitions.example: Celine Dion topped the UK music charts twice in the 1990s.

definitions.definition: To commit suicide.
definitions.example: Depression causes many people to top themselves.

definitions.definition: To murder.
(BDSM) To be the dominant partner in a BDSM relationship or roleplay.
definitions.example: Giving advice to the dominant partner on how to run the BDSM session is called "topping from the bottom".

definitions.definition: (gay sexuality) To be the partner who penetrates in anal sex.
(gay sexuality) To anally penetrate.
To rise aloft; to be eminent; to tower.
definitions.example: lofty ridges and topping mountains

definitions.definition: To predominate.
definitions.example: topping passions

definitions.definition: To excel; to rise above others.
To raise one end of (a yard, etc.), making it higher than the other.
(dyeing) To cover with another dye.
definitions.example: to top aniline black with methyl violet to prevent greening

definitions.definition: To put a stiffening piece or back on (a saw blade).
To arrange (fruit, etc.) with the best on top.
(of a horse) To strike the top of (an obstacle) with the hind feet while jumping, so as to gain new impetus.
To improve (domestic animals, especially sheep) by crossing certain individuals or breeds with other superior breeds.
To cut, break, or otherwise take off the top of (a steel ingot) to remove unsound metal.
To strike (the ball) above the centre; also, to make (a stroke, etc.) by hitting the ball in this way.
Any food item added on top of another, such as sprinkles on ice cream or pepperoni on pizza.
The act of cutting off the top of something.
The act of raising one extremity of a spar higher than the other.
Either of the cables that support the ends of a spar or boom.
The tail of an artificial fly.
Wonderful
Assuming superiority; proud.
A room in a store for trying on clothes before purchase.
(driving) An act of turning around a car, involving one forward turn and two backward turns (or vice-versa)
One who robs others in a lawless area, especially as part of a group.
An outlaw.
One who cheats others.
An enemy aircraft.
A runner who covertly joins a race without having registered as a participant.
To rob, or steal from, in the manner of a bandit.
Filled with grief or sadness; being in a state in which one mourns.
Fit to inspire mourning; tragic.
A glossy, resinous material used as a surface coating; either a natural exudation of certain trees, or a solution of nitrocellulose in alcohol, etc.
A similar finish, baked onto the inside of cans.
To apply a lacquer to something or to give something a smooth, glossy finish.
The quantum of light and other electromagnetic energy, regarded as a discrete particle having zero rest mass, no electric charge, and an indefinitely long lifetime. It is a gauge boson.
A partial or total loss of language skills due to brain damage. Usually, damage to the left perisylvian region, including Broca's area and Wernicke's area, causes aphasia.
Lazy; idle; tending to sloth.
The act of collecting information related to current events
definitions.example: Our network has the best newsgathering operation in the country.

definitions.definition: To emerge from (something); to take a particular shape as a result of (something); to come to exist from (an origin).
To become too physically large for something, especially clothes.
definitions.example: I give my old clothes to charity when I've grown out of them.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To become too mature for something.
(of acts) Neither moral nor immoral.
(of people) Not believing in or caring for morality and immorality.
Service or activity done for the benefit of the community at large, such as cleaning, fundraising, pro bono professional services, etc.
Such work done as alternative for a criminal penalty.
A trial; an experiment; an attempt.
Of or pertaining to a trial or trials; essaying; experimental.
Uncertain; subject to future change.
Any plant of the genus Clematis, vigorous climbing lianas found throughout the temperate zones.
A pleasure trip or excursion.
A marine in the English navy.
To amuse or divert.
Full of merriment and high spirits; jovial.
Full of life and mirth; jouous; merry.
Splendid, excellent, pleasant
Large
Very, extremely
Having the same pronunciation.
definitions.example: "Cot" and "caught" are homophonous in some American accents, as are "there" and "they're".

definitions.definition: Homophonic; sounding the same.
Someone, usually male, whose job it is to collect refuse from people's homes and take it to be processed.
To change with a specific direction, progress.
definitions.example: Let's see how things develop and then make our decision.

definitions.definition: To progress through a sequence of stages.
definitions.example: Isabel developed from a tropical depression to a tropical storm to a hurricane.   An embryo develops into a fetus and then into an infant.

definitions.definition: To advance; to further; to promote the growth of.
To create.
definitions.example: I need to develop a plan for the next three weeks.

definitions.definition: To bring out images latent in photographic film.
definitions.example: Please develop this roll of film.

definitions.definition: To acquire something usually over a period of time.
definitions.example: I have been in England enough to develop a British accent.

definitions.definition: To place one's pieces actively.
definitions.example: I need to develop my white-square bishop.

definitions.definition: To cause a ball to become more open and available to be played on later. Usually by moving it away from the cushion, or by opening a pack.
To change the form of (an algebraic expression, etc.) by executing certain indicated operations without changing the value.
A process of development.
In the process of development.
definitions.example: a developing foetus

definitions.definition: Of a country: becoming economically more mature or advanced; becoming industrialized.
The front part of a property or building that faces the street.
The land between a property and the street.
The length of a property along a street.
Property or territory adjacent to a body of water.
The front part generally.
Cowardly, lacking courage.

A bicycle specially designed for off-road riding, typically with straight, flat handlebars, a heavier frame than road bikes, higher ground clearance, and wider tires, sometimes with knobs on them for greater traction.
One who skis.
A ball hit high in the air, often leading to a catch.
A regular night on which a couple to go out on a date. For example, a couple may go on a date every Friday night.
The house sparrow, Passer domesticus; a small bird with a short bill, and brown, white and gray feathers.
A member of the family Passeridae, comprising small Old World songbirds.
A member of the family Emberizidae, comprising small New World songbirds.
Generically, any small, nondescript bird.
A quick-witted, lively person. Often used in the phrase cockney sparrow.
In a tolerant manner.
With tolerance.
The crime of causing an accident, as with a motor vehicle, and leaving without acknowledging responsibility.
A play in baseball where the baserunners leave their base before the batter hits the ball, assuming that the batter will in fact hit the ball and this will give them an advantage.
The military technique of attacking one place and then quickly moving to another before defenders can react.
Of, pertaining to, or being a hit and run.
Making a transit or passage.
Affected by transference of signification.
(grammar, of a verb) Taking a direct object or objects.
definitions.example: The English verb "to notice" is a transitive verb, because we say things like "She noticed a problem".

definitions.definition: (of a relation on a set) Having the property that if an element x is related to y and y is related to z, then x is necessarily related to z.
definitions.example: "Is an ancestor of" is a transitive relation: if Alice is an ancestor of Bob, and Bob is an ancestor of Carol, then Alice is an ancestor of Carol.

definitions.definition: (of a group action) Such that, for any two elements of the acted-upon set, some group element maps the first to the second.
(of a graph) Such that, for any two vertices there exists an automorphism which maps one to the other.
A sin.
(fiqh) Forbidden by Islam: unlawful, sinful.
A person who makes or dispenses lenses, spectacles.
A person who sells lenses, spectacles etc.
A bin for holding rubbish until it can be collected; a garbage can.

The largest of all musical instruments, played from an organ console which produces its sound by sending air through whistles and/or reeds called organ pipes, by direct mechanical action, or modernly, electrically.
To put forward; to offer for discussion or debate.
The act of redecorating
A replacement decoration
Something small enough to escape casual notice.
definitions.example: Note this fine detail in the lower left corner.

definitions.definition: A profusion of details.
definitions.example: This etching is full of fine detail.

definitions.definition: The small things that can escape casual notice.
Something considered trivial enough to ignore.
definitions.example: I don't concern myself with the details of accounting.

definitions.definition: A person's name, address and other personal information.
definitions.example: The arresting officer asked the suspect for his details.

definitions.definition: (law enforcement) A temporary unit or assignment.
An individual feature, fact, or other item, considered separately from the whole of which it is a part.
A narrative which relates minute points; an account which dwells on particulars.
A selected portion of a painting
To explain in detail.
definitions.example: I'll detail the exact procedure to you later.

definitions.definition: To clean carefully (particularly of road vehicles) (always pronounced. /ˈdiːteɪl/)
definitions.example: We need to have the minivan detailed.

definitions.definition: To assign to a particular task
Ornamentation on something that has been constructed.
definitions.example: a dress with elaborate neck detailings

definitions.definition: Abbreviation of circa.
definitions.example: The document was written in the Middle Ages, c. 1250.

definitions.definition: The middle tone in either one of the sets of seven white keys on a keyboard or a set of seven strings on a stringed instrument.
(stative) To perceive or detect with the eyes, or as if by sight.
To form a mental picture of.
(social) To meet, to visit.
To be the setting or time of.
definitions.example: 1999 saw the release of many great films.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To ensure that something happens, especially while witnessing it.
definitions.example: I'll see you hang for this!  I saw that they didn't make any more trouble.

definitions.definition: To wait upon; attend, escort.
definitions.example: I saw the old lady safely across the road.

definitions.definition: To respond to another player's bet with a bet of equal value.
definitions.example: I'll see your twenty dollars and raise you ten.

definitions.definition: To determine by trial or experiment; to find out (if or whether).
definitions.example: I'll come over later and see if I can fix your computer.

definitions.definition: (used in the imperative) To reference or to study for further details.
definitions.example: For a complete proof of the Poincaré conjecture, see Appendix C.

definitions.definition: To examine something closely, or to utilize something, often as a temporary alternative.
definitions.example: Can I see that lighter for a second? Mine just quit working.

definitions.definition: To include as one of something's experiences.
definitions.example: The equipment has not seen usage outside of our projects.

definitions.definition: A kind of chocolate chip cookie.
A site at which refuse is buried under layers of earth.
The material so disposed of.
To dispose of (garbage) by burying it at a landfill site.
That may be passed or traversed.
Tolerable; adequate; no more than satisfactory.
Able to "pass", or be accepted as a member of a race, sex or other group to which society would not otherwise regard one as belonging.
A vegetable oil, pressed from olives, and used in cooking and as a salad dressing; it is high in unsaturated fatty acids.
A game where one group has to keep an object, normally a ball, within their group and away from another group or individual.
(by extension) Keeping something between one's own group, away from others.
A person caught in an awkward situation between two other people.
The control of a vehicle by either one of two people
The equipment that allows such control
A bright light, with a lens and reflector, on the front of a motor vehicle (or originally a ship or train), designed to illuminate the road when driving at night; normally one of a pair.
(chiefly in the plural) A woman's breast.
(chiefly in the plural) A woman's erect nipples, partially masked by clothing.
(chiefly in the plural) A jewel; especially a diamond.
(chiefly in the plural) Lysergic acid diethylamide (LSD).
The quality of being impudent, not showing due respect.
Impudent language, conduct or behavior.
A kind of four-wheeled tractor, often yellow, used in construction, which has a one-man cabin and a large scoop at the front which can be used to dig up dirt or other material
The scoop of a front-end loader
A press conference.
To enclose, contain or separate by building fence.
To defend or guard.
To engage in the selling or buying of stolen goods.
To engage in the sport of fencing.
To jump over a fence.
To conceal the truth by giving equivocal answers; to hedge; to be evasive.
The art or sport of duelling with swords, especially with the 17th- to 18th-century European dueling swords and the practice weapons descended from them (sport fencing)
Material used to make fences, fences used as barriers or an enclosure.
definitions.example: Fencing was erected around the field to keep the horses in.

definitions.definition: A toxic chemical compound and banned weapon of mass destruction which, when inhaled or ingested, impairs nervous system functions, typically causing extreme physical distress and death by asphyxiation.
A player of a ball game; especially a basketball, baseball, or football player.
An underhanded, tricky person given to sharp practise; a sharper; a cheat.
Counterfeit money
Disparaging or derisive in an insinuative way.
definitions.example: Don't make snide remarks to me.

definitions.definition: Tricky; deceptive; false; spurious; contemptible.
definitions.example: He was a snide lawyer.

definitions.definition: An item of underwear worn to support the breasts; now commonly shortened to bra.
One of the two vectors in the standard notation for describing quantum states in quantum mechanics, the other being the ket.
Friend
definitions.example: Take it easy, bra!

definitions.definition: Female version of bro
The predictive or statistical study of elections.
An ancient Greek method of numerology, similar to gematria.
A holy or sacred place dedicated to a specific deity, ancestor, hero, martyr, saint, or similar figure of awe and respect, at which said figure is venerated or worshipped.
A case, box, or receptacle, especially one in which are deposited sacred relics, as the bones of a saint.
A place or object hallowed from its history or associations.
definitions.example: a shrine of art

definitions.definition: To enshrine; to place reverently, as if in a shrine.
A potato that has been baked for eating.
That causes great grief, anguish or distress.
That elicits deep sympathy.
Non-fat milk; milk that has had the cream removed.
definitions.example: We like to drink skim milk instead so as to consume fewer calories.

definitions.definition: Of, pertaining to, or completing a period of 100 years.
Relating to a hundred of anything.
The hundredth anniversary of an event or happening.
A very thin sheet of metal.
Thin aluminium/aluminum (or, formerly, tin) used for wrapping food.
definitions.example: wrap the sandwich up in foil

definitions.definition: A thin layer of metal put between a jewel and its setting to make it seem more brilliant.
(authorship) In literature, theatre/theater, etc., a character who helps emphasize the traits of the main character and who usually acts as an opponent or antagonist.
Anything that acts by contrast to emphasise the characteristics of something.
A very thin sword with a blunted (or foiled) tip
A thin, transparent plastic material on which marks are made and projected for the purposes of presentation. See transparency.
A stylized flower or leaf.
A hydrofoil.
An aerofoil/airfoil.
To cover or wrap with foil.
Failure when on the point of attainment; defeat; frustration; miscarriage.
One of the incorrect answers presented in a multiple-choice test.
To prevent (something) from being accomplished.
definitions.example: I was foiled by my superior

definitions.definition: To prevent (someone) from accomplishing something.
definitions.example: They foiled my plans.

definitions.definition: To blunt; to dull; to spoil.
definitions.example: to foil the scent in hunting

definitions.definition: To tread underfoot; to trample.
The track of an animal.
To expand a product of two or more algebraic expressions, typically binomials.
To defile; to soil.
Marriage equality; the acceptance of same-sex as well as heterosexual marriages.
Any of several species of large marine annelid worm of the genus Arenicola
A shrub or tree of the tribe Acacieae.
The thickened or dried juice of several species in Acacieae, in particular Vachellia nilotica (syn. Acacia nilotica), the Egyptian acacia.
A false acacia; robinia tree, Robinia pseudoacacia.
Gum arabic; gum acacia.
Any of several related trees, such as the locust tree.
A light to moderate greenish yellow with a hint of red.
(history) A roll or bag, filled with dust, borne by Byzantine emperors, as a memento of mortality. It is represented on medals.
A person's navel
A man who is a leader in national or international affairs.
A male political leader who promotes the public good or who is recognized for probity, leadership, or the qualities necessary to govern a state.
In the dialect of the English Lake District and nearby, a man who lives on a landed estate; a small landholder.
A milky liquid made from oats and used as a milk substitute, cooking ingredient or beverage.
A passenger vehicle which combines the towing capacity of a pickup truck with the passenger-carrying space of a minivan or station wagon together with on- or off-road ability.
The process of inhaling and exhaling; breathing, breath.
An act of breathing; a breath.
Any similar process in an organism that lacks lungs that exchanges gases with its environment.
The process by which cells obtain chemical energy by the consumption of oxygen and the release of carbon dioxide.
A cord or tendon of the body.
A cord or string, particularly as of a musical instrument.
Muscular power, muscle; nerve, nervous energy; vigor, vigorous strength.
(often in the plural) That which gives strength or in which strength consists; a supporting factor or member; mainstay.
A nerve.
To knit together or make strong with, or as if with, sinews.
The face of a building, especially the front view or elevation.
(by extension) The face or front (most visible side) of any other thing, such as an organ.
A deceptive or insincere outward appearance; a front.
An object serving as a simplified interface to a larger body of code, as in the facade pattern.
The chemical element (symbol Ne) with an atomic number of 10. The lightest of the noble gases, it is a colourless, odorless inert gas.
A form or sample of the element.
Neon signs or lights, collectively.
A neon tetra fish.
(of a color) That resembles a neon light; extremely bright; fluorescent
(maritime) The ship occupied by the fleet's commander (usually an admiral); it denotes this by flying his flag.
(maritime) The ship regarded as most important out of a group, e.g. a nation's navy or company's fleet.
(by extension) The most important one out of a related group.
definitions.example: The retail company's store in London is their flagship.

definitions.definition: To act as a flagship for
The opinion of the public, the popular view.
To fill by packing or crowding something into; to cram with something; to load to excess.
definitions.example: I'm going to stuff this pillow with feathers.

definitions.definition: To fill a space with (something) in a compressed manner.
definitions.example: He stuffed his clothes into the closet and shut the door.

definitions.definition: To fill with seasoning.
definitions.example: She stuffed the turkey for Thanksgiving using her secret recipe.

definitions.definition: To load goods into (a container) for transport.
(used in the passive) To sate.
definitions.example: I’m stuffed after having eaten all that turkey, mashed potatoes and delicious stuffing.

definitions.definition: (pronominal) To eat, especially in a hearty or greedy manner.
definitions.example: She sits on the sofa all day, watching TV and stuffing herself with cream buns.

definitions.definition: To break; to destroy.
definitions.example: He skidded off the road and totally stuffed his brand new car.

definitions.definition: To sexually penetrate.
definitions.example: His wife came home early and found him on the couch stuffing the maid.

definitions.definition: (mildly vulgar, often imperative) Used to contemptuously dismiss or reject something. See also stuff it.
definitions.example: Stuff your stupid rules, I'll do what I like.

definitions.definition: To heavily defeat or get the better of.
definitions.example: Mudchester Rovers were stuffed 7-0 in the semi-final.

definitions.definition: To cut off another competitor in a race by disturbing his projected and committed racing line (trajectory) by an abrupt manoeuvre.
definitions.example: I got stuffed by that guy on the supermoto going into that turn, almost causing us to crash.

definitions.definition: To preserve a dead bird or other animal by filling its skin.
To obstruct, as any of the organs; to affect with some obstruction in the organs of sense or respiration.
To form or fashion by packing with the necessary material.
To crowd with facts; to cram the mind of; sometimes, to crowd or fill with false or idle tales or fancies.
To compress (a file or files) in the StuffIt format, to be unstuffed later.
Full or packed (with some material or substance).
definitions.example: Customs officers look closely through a stuffed suitcase.

definitions.definition: Filled with seasoning
definitions.example: We're having stuffed turkey for dinner.

definitions.definition: Full after eating.
definitions.example: Stuffed children sleep poorly.

definitions.definition: Very tired.
Broken, not functional; in trouble, in a situation from which one is unlikely to recover.
A writ summoning one to answer to any action.
An answer to any action.
A memorandum of points of fact or of law for use in conducting a case.
(by extension) A position of interest or advocacy.
An attorney's legal argument in written form for submission to a court.
(English law) The material relevant to a case, delivered by a solicitor to the barrister who tries the case.
A short news story or report.
definitions.example: We got a news brief.

definitions.definition: (usually in the plural) undershorts briefs.
definitions.example: I wear boxers under trousers but for sports I usually wear a brief.

definitions.definition: A summary, précis or epitome; an abridgement or abstract.
A letter patent, from proper authority, authorizing a collection or charitable contribution of money in churches, for any public or private purpose.
(slang) A ticket of any type.
To summarize a recent development to some person with decision-making power.
definitions.example: The U.S. president was briefed on the military coup and its implications on African stability.

definitions.definition: To write a legal argument and submit it to a court.
A line around the body at the waist; its measurement
The narrowest part of a garment, usually at the waist, but may be above or below depending on the dictates of fashion or the whim of the designer
Person having a large waistline
An official test to determine if someone has taken alcohol or drugs by testing a sample of their exhaled breath.
Traditional music, as opposed to popular music or classical music.
Music that combines elements from traditional styles from the non-Western world along with modern, popular elements, in order to create something marketed towards Western audiences.
A melody added to an existing one, especially one added to provide harmony whilst each retains its simultaneous identity; a composition consisting of such contrapuntal melodies.
Any similar contrasting element in a work of art.
An opposite point.
To compose or arrange such music.
To serve as an opposing point against.
The topmost covering of a bed, often functioning as a blanket; a coverlet.
A theory or belief that the whole is greater than the sum of the parts.
A practice based on such a theory or belief.
An underground prison or vault, typically built underneath a castle.
The main tower of a motte or castle; a keep or donjon.
A shrewd person.
(games) An area inhabited by enemies, containing story objectives, treasure and bosses.
(BDSM) A room dedicated to sadomasochistic sexual activity.
To imprison in a dungeon.
To shape something into a curve.
definitions.example: The carpenter rounded the edges of the table.

definitions.definition: To become shaped into a curve.
(with "out") To finish; to complete; to fill out.
definitions.example: She rounded out her education with only a single mathematics class.

definitions.definition: To approximate a number, especially a decimal number by the closest whole number.
definitions.example: Ninety-five rounds up to one hundred.

definitions.definition: To turn past a boundary.
definitions.example: Helen watched him until he rounded the corner.

definitions.definition: To turn and attack someone or something (used with on).
definitions.example: As a group of policemen went past him, one of them rounded on him, grabbing him by the arm.

definitions.definition: To advance to home plate.
definitions.example: And the runners round the bases on the double by Jones.

definitions.definition: To go round, pass, go past.
To encircle; to encompass.
To grow round or full; hence, to attain to fullness, completeness, or perfection.
To do ward rounds.
To go round, as a guard; to make the rounds.
To go or turn round; to wheel about.
To speak in a low tone; whisper; speak secretly; take counsel.
To address or speak to in a whisper, utter in a whisper.
Made into a circle or sphere.
Complete or balanced.
Describing a number that has been changed to its nearest desired value.
Ending in a broad arch.
(of a vowel etc.) Pronounced with the lips drawn together.
definitions.example: The sound /u/ is a rounded vowel.
